title: Prohibits banking organizations from issuing checks for unsolicited loans
summary: Prohibits banking organizations from issuing checks or drafts to any person or other legal entity when the endorsement or deposit of such check or draft by such person or other legal entity would constitute such person's or other legal entity's acceptance of an unsolicited loan from such banking organization.

       Introduced  by  Sen. SAMPSON -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Banks

       AN ACT to amend the banking law, in relation to prohibiting  banks  from
         issuing checks whose endorsement constitutes acceptance of an unsolic-
         ited loan

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The banking law is amended by adding a new section  9-v  to
    2  read as follows:
    3    S  9-V.  BANKING  ORGANIZATIONS  PROHIBITED  FROM ISSUING CHECKS WHOSE
    4  ENDORSEMENT CONSTITUTES ACCEPTANCE OF AN UNSOLICITED LOAN.   NO  BANKING
    5  ORGANIZATION  SHALL ISSUE A CHECK OR DRAFT TO ANY PERSON, FIRM, PARTNER-
    6  SHIP, CORPORATION OR OTHER LEGAL ENTITY IF THE ENDORSEMENT OR DEPOSIT OF
    7  SUCH CHECK OR DRAFT BY THE PAYEE WOULD CONSTITUTE THE  ACCEPTANCE  OF  A
    8  LOAN  FROM  SUCH BANKING ORGANIZATION TO SUCH PAYEE WITHOUT SUCH PAYEE'S
    9  HAVING SOLICITED SUCH LOAN.
   10    S 2. This act shall take effect on the one hundred twentieth day after
   11  it shall have become a law; provided, however, that effective immediate-
   12  ly, the addition, amendment, and/or repeal of any rule or regulation  by
   13  the superintendent of banks necessary for the implementation of this act
   14  on  its  effective  date  are  authorized  and  directed  to be made and
   15  completed on or before such effective date.



        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
